PostCSS is a tool for transforming styles with JS plugins. These plugins can lint your CSS, support variables and mixins, transpile future CSS syntax, inline images, and more.

Run npx autoprefixer --info to check which browsers are selected and which properties will be prefixed.

Methods

(static) Autoprefixer() Method

Summary:

PostCSS plugin to parse CSS and add vendor prefixes to CSS rules using values from Can I Use.

Source:
js/postcss.config.js, line 16
See:

github/autoprefixer

Example
autoprefixer: {
     add: true, // add prefixes
     env: '.browserslistrc', // environment for Browserslist
     flexbox: true, // add prefixes for flexbox properties
     grid: true, // add IE prefixes for Grid Layout properties
     remove: true, // remove outdated prefixes
     supports: true // add prefixes for @supports
},

(static) Colorguard() @deprecated Method

Summary:

CSS Colorguard helps you maintain the color set that you want, and warns you when colors you've added are too similar to ones that already exist. Naturally, it's all configurable to your tastes.

Source:
js/postcss.config.js, line 42
See:

github/css-colorguard

(static) CSSnano() Method

Summary:

A modern, modular compression tool written on top of the PostCSS ecosystem, which allows us to use a lot of powerful features in order to compact CSS appropriately.

Source:
js/postcss.config.js, line 59
See:

github/cssnano

Example
cssnano: { preset: 'default' },

(static) FilterStream() @deprecated Method

Summary:

PostCSS plugin which allows you to blacklist files and/or folders that you don't want to process with a given PostCSS plugin.

Source:
js/postcss.config.js, line 73
See:

github/postcss-filter-stream

(static) PresetEnv() Method

Summary:

PostCSS Preset Env lets you convert modern CSS into something most browsers can understand, determining the polyfills you need based on your targeted browsers or runtime environments.

Source:
js/postcss.config.js, line 89
See:

github/postcss-preset-env

Example
'postcss-preset-env': { stage: 3 // use stage 3 features },

(static) Sorting() Method

Summary:

PostCSS plugin to keep rules & at-rules (@...) content in order.

Source:
js/postcss.config.js, line 103
See:

github/postcss-sorting

Example
'postcss-sorting': {
     order: [
         'custom-properties',
         'dollar-variables',
         'declarations',
         'at-rules',
         'rules'
     ],
     'properties-order': [
         'background',
         'border',
         'padding',
         'margin'
     ],
     'unspecified-properties-position': 'bottom'
}

Settings

Code Ligatures

Typographic ligatures are when multiple characters appear to combine into a single character. Simplistically, when you type two or more characters & they magically attach to each other, you're using ligatures that were supported by your OS, your app, and your font.
